refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: donnatella is a GUI file manager.

listitem.para: Use DIR as configuration directory, instead of the default ($XDG_CONFIG_HOME/donnatella).
If it doesn't exist, it will be created and default configuration & marks will be loaded from the system config dir (e.g. /etc/xdg/donnatella)
Set the log level to LEVEL, defining which messages will be shown by the log handler.
Valid log levels are (in order) :
error : only show fatal error messages
critical : also show critical warnings
warning : also show warnings (default log level)
message : also show messages
info : also show informative messages
debug : also show main debug messages
debug2 : show more debug messages
debug3 : show even more debug messages
debug4 : show all possible debug messages
Increase verbosity of log; Can be repeated multiple times.
Turns off verbosity;Same as --log-level=error
Use LAYOUT as layout for the main window, instead of option donna/layout
Start main window maximized.
Define "filters" for the debug log messages, and sets the log level to debug.

In addition to the log level, by default only "generic" debug messages will be shown. Certain debug messages are assigned to a component of donna, and a corresponding filter must be activated for such messages to show.
The following filters are available:
node : debug messages relating to nodes. Can be restructed using domain.
task : debug messages relating to tasks.
treeview : debug messages relating to treeviews. Can be restricted using treeview names.
terminal : debug messages relating to embedded terminals. Can be restricted using terminal names.
task-manager : debug messages relating to the task manager.
provider : debug messages relating to providers. Can be restricted using domain.
config : debug messages relating to the configuration manager.
app : debug messages relating to donna in general.
all : all debug messages (same as specifying all the filters above)
Certain filters allow "restrictions," where you can follow the filter by a colon and one or more identifiers (as specified above), separated by a plus sign, to limit which the messages to show.
For example, to only show debug messages from treeviews "foo" and "bar" you would use: --debug treeview:foo+bar
Show version info & exit
